feeds.title: Putin and Trump's envoy set for key Ukraine talks in Moscow
feeds.description: Steve Witkoff will hold talks at the Kremlin, after the White House said it was "optimistic" about a breakthrough.

feeds.title: US Navy commander ordered second  Venezuela boat strike, White House says
feeds.description: The White House confirmed the second strikes on 2 September, but denied reports that Defence Secretary Hegseth said "kill everybody" on board the vessel.

feeds.title: India tells smartphone makers to put state-run cyber safety app on new devices
feeds.description: India wants all smartphone makers to pre-install new devices with a state-owned cyber security app.

feeds.title: Honduras presidential candidates locked in 'technical tie', official says
feeds.description: Right-wing candidate Nasry Asfura leads former TV host Salvador Nasralla by just 515 votes, according to country's electoral authority.

feeds.title: Mangione in court as lawyers seek to rule out notebook, gun and other key evidence
feeds.description: A legal expert explains how the defence could stand to gain even if their longshot bid fails this week.

feeds.title: Hong Kong leader orders investigation into deadly fire that killed 151
feeds.description: The fire is the deadliest the city has seen in more than 70 years.

feeds.title: Italian town freezes Pavarotti statue knee-deep in Christmas ice rink, angering widow
feeds.description: The opera legend's widow said the town had made an "absurd decision" after it also encouraged skaters to high five the statue.

feeds.title: Appeals court disqualifies ex-Trump lawyer Alina Habba as New Jersey prosecutor
feeds.description: An appeals court disqualified Alina Habba, Trump's former personal attorney, from serving as US Attorney for New Jersey.

feeds.title: Death toll in Indonesia floods passes 600
feeds.description: Another 500 people are missing, while thousands more have been injured after a cyclone hit the region.

feeds.title: Shock in Cameroon as 74-year-old opposition firebrand dies in detention
feeds.description: Anicet Ekane's lawyer says the family was given little explanation - "his wife was just presented the corpse".

feeds.title: What does it mean when Uncle Sam is one of your biggest shareholders? Chip startup xLight is about to find out
feeds.description: You can imagine how this is all going over in Silicon Valley, where the libertarian ethos runs deep.

feeds.title: Apple just named a new AI chief with Google and Microsoft expertise, as John Giannandrea steps down
feeds.description: His replacement is Amar Subramanya, a highly regarded Microsoft executive who spent 16 years at Google, most recently leading engineering for the Gemini Assistant. It's a savvy hire, given that Subramanya knows the competition intimately.

feeds.title: One of Google’s biggest AI advantages is what it already knows about you
feeds.description: The promise is AI that's uniquely helpful because it knows you. But the risk is AI that feels more like surveillance than service.

feeds.title: Zillow drops climate risk scores after agents complained of lost sales
feeds.description: The move is a loss for homebuyers, who through Zillow had ready access to a property's climate risk scores from First Street.

feeds.title: Shopify resolves outage disrupting merchants on Cyber Monday
feeds.description: Shopify was down for many merchants this morning, preventing them from processing transactions. It appears to be fixed now.

feeds.title: Nvidia announces new open AI models and tools for autonomous driving research
feeds.description: Nvidia continues its push into physical AI with the release of a new reasoning world model and other tools for physical AI.

feeds.title: AWS re:Invent 2025: How to watch and follow along live
feeds.description: Amazon Web Services’ big annual event, re:Invent 2025, is getting into full swing in Las Vegas this week, and you can follow the keynotes live right here.

feeds.title: MKBHD’s wallpaper app Panels is shutting down
feeds.description: From the time Brownlee launched Panels in September 2024, the app struggled to find an audience of its own. "We knew it was niche … and ultimately, we weren't able to turn it into the vision I had," Marques Brownlee said.

feeds.title: Construction workers are cashing in on the AI boom
feeds.description: "I pinch myself going to work every day," one 51-year-old says of his new supervisor role overseeing 200 workers at a data center site.

feeds.title: Data center energy demand forecasted to soar nearly 300% through 2035
feeds.description: New planned data centers promise to consume even more energy than expected. Meanwhile, a grid monitor is blaming such growth for high electricity prices.
